result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Madison L. Brown

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Case called at 10:31AM
Defendant Madison L. Brown appeared by video.  Attorney William Ginsberg appeared by video. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

recess 10:34AM

NEXT: Status Conference on 12/15 at 9:30AM with in person appearances

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 9:22am 
Defendant Madison L. Brown appears. Attorney William Ginsberg appears.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Brown waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Counsel indicate that lab blood testing results are awaited, so the scheduling of the arraignment on a later date is proposed.
recess 9:26am 

NEXT:  Arraignment on September 30th at 10:30am with Zoom appearances
Waiver of Prelim on July 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Not a proposed order, but the court will grant the request for a Zoom waiver.

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

--No consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physician
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ma] Case called at 1:27 PM 
Defendant Madison L. Brown appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney William Ginsberg.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--No consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physician
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:35 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/13/22 at 9:00am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 7/26/22 at 9:00am
